issues: Major semantic conflict: env_medium 'epixylon' (wood surface) contradicts freshwater river biome and riffle environment
Environmental hierarchy mismatch: riffle (rocky stream bed) incompatible with epixylon (wood substrate)
Land cover shows deciduous broadleaf forest but sample is from aquatic riffle environment
Coordinate discrepancy: 0.6km difference between asserted coords and geocoded location
Elevation difference: 12.3m between asserted (76.7m) and geospatial (89.0m)
Env_package 'water' doesn't align with epixylon substrate sampling
Sample name suggests epixylon but environmental context indicates aquatic riffle
recommendations: CRITICAL: Verify env_medium - should be aquatic substrate (e.g., ENVO:00002007 'sediment') not epixylon for riffle sampling
Review sampling methodology - clarify if sampling wood surfaces in stream or stream bed substrate
Validate coordinates against Mayfield Creek location - consider using geocoded coordinates (32.9550101, -87.4082325)
Update elevation to geospatially-derived value (89.0m) for better accuracy
Ensure env_medium matches the actual substrate being sampled in the riffle environment
Consider env_medium alternatives: streambed sediment, benthic material, or aquatic substrate
Verify sample collection protocol aligns with metadata - riffle sampling typically targets sediment/biofilm, not wood
